intro: Erythranthe glaucescens, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glaucous leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early spring. Erythranthe glaucescens is often found in open meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
